indications: Roundworms, hookworms, pinworms and vaginal trichomonas infections
This is strong and effective and can be used by itself
As a wash or a powder made into a thick paste with vinegar for tinea

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Liver or Heart disease.
Contraindicated for those with peptic ulcers.
Use with caution for those with weak constitutions.
Use with caution for those with Spleen and Stomach Deficiency Cold.
Do not take large doses or long term.

useCases: As an enema for pinworms every night for two to four nights
Hookworm (serve before bedtime on an empty Stomach for two days)
Parasites (powder and insert into the rectum or vagina)
Topically for tinea and sores (powder and mix)

notes: It can be applied externally for scabies and sores.
It is said to treat roving Wind-rash, noxious sores, scabies, lichen and high fever in children.
This herb is also said to control diarrhea.

Both Ku Lian Pi and Fr. Quisqualis #{ShiJunZi} Shi Jun Zi expel parasites and are effective for expelling roundworms. Ku Lian Pi is bitter, cold, clears Damp-Heat, is hard on the digestion and is relatively toxic. Shi Jun Zi is sweet, warm, augments the Spleen and Stomach, treats accumulations in childhood nutritional impairment and eliminates Deficiency Heat.
